#summary HC05 Bluetooth for Little Robot(tm)
#labels v5.3,LittleRobot

= Introduction =

The HC05 Bluetooth module allows communication with the prop via bluetooth.  No cables are needed after initial programming. 

Connect:

|| HC05 Bluetooth ||
|| HC05  || Prop || Wire Color||
||Pin 1 TX   - P25  - Grey  ||
||Pin 2 RX   - P26  - white||
||Pin 34 Key - P27   - Green||
||Pin 12 3.3v - 3.3v - Orange||
||Pin 13 GND  - GND  - Blue||

The HC05 does not have "PINS" per se.  It has teeny micro notches that are much closer together than the standard .1 inch spacing I usually work with.  But, you can solder a bit of wire to the notch, and make a connection to the prop. You can put a pin on the other end of the wire, and jab it right into the bread board or 40 pin female connector on a Quickstart board.

You can use any color wire you want, if you use the same color as we do yours will match the pictures. :)


{{{
fl

\ for the HC05

\ green wire       GREEN
27 wconstant hcProgPin

\ white/orange wire GREY
26 wconstant hcRx

\ white/green wire  WHITE
25 wconstant hcTx

\ ORANGE 3.3v
\ BLUE Ground

9600 4/ wconstant hcBaud

0 wconstant hcSerialCog

hcSerialCog cogreset 100 delms
c" hcRx hcTx hcBaud serial" hcSerialCog cogx 100 delms
1 hcSerialCog sersetflags


: hcSend
	cogid hcSerialCog iolink .cstr 1000 delms cogid iounlink cr
;

hcProgPin pinhi hcProgPin pinout

c" AT+VERSION~h0D~h0A" hcSend
c" AT+ROLE?~h0D~h0A" hcSend
c" AT+UART?~h0D~h0A" hcSend
c" AT+NAME?~h0D~h0A" hcSend
c" AT+PSWD?~h0D~h0A" hcSend
c" AT+NAME=SanciHc05-1~h0D~h0A" hcSend
c" AT+PSWD=9097~h0D~h0A" hcSend
c" AT+UART=230400,0,0~h0D~h0A" hcSend
c" AT+VERSION~h0D~h0A" hcSend
c" AT+ROLE?~h0D~h0A" hcSend
c" AT+UART?~h0D~h0A" hcSend
c" AT+NAME?~h0D~h0A" hcSend
c" AT+PSWD?~h0D~h0A" hcSend

hcProgPin pinlo 

\ after the hc05 is power cycled, the baud rate will change, not like the hc06



}}}
